comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: According to Earthlore, the Notre Dame was "[s]lightly damaged by shelling in 1914", however "the cathedral survived both World wars virtually intact." www.elore.com/el04ho01.html

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: A special dispatch to the New York Times recounting a deadly air raid that killed three and injured 14 in Paris on October 12, 1914, including setting the roof of Notre Dame on fire. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9802EED8143EE0... A short account in the New York times, dated October 13, 1914, claiming that French aviators had routed the German airmen over Paris that day and that "Notre Dame little damaged". query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A07E4DA1438E0...
